page.title: 07BIOGRAPHY OF SIR R ARKWRIGHT
page.content: Captain Arkwright, the inventor of the Spinning Jenny has descendents living at Hatton House in Hatton Village. Two of the Arkwright family were killed in the 2nd World War and the next generation is still living in Hatton. Sir Richard Arkwright was born in 1732. In 1764 he started work on a water driven frame for spinning which introduced power machinery to the textile industry. The machinery produced a strong thread, strong enough to be used as a warp, or lengthwise thread for machine-operated looms. In 1768 he had finished the machine which he called the 'Spinning Jenny'.The machine was not patented until the following year. He then opened textile factories in Nottingham. In 1792 he died in Hatton where he had lived all his life.
